data.text:
“We should try to avoid a K-shaped recovery, whereby one part of the economy (high-skill, digital) recovers but another part (low-skill, women, young people) are left behind,” explains IMF Chief @KGeorgieva at @ASCOA.

Watch the conversation with @s_segal https://t.co/a5odTXybJL https://t.co/d2tmJrkAAt

With women in #LatAm & the Caribbean disproportionately affected by COVID-19, focusing on closing the gender gap may just be the best post-pandemic recovery plan. Today we covered these topics and more w/ @KGeorgieva and @ASCOA @s_segal.

Watch the video: https://t.co/l2OxZsuNXf https://t.co/ygol2byd3B

Deputy Managing Director Antoinette Sayeh at the Rome Investment Forum 2020 #RIF2020: Green and digital infrastructure investment will help build the foundation of a 21st century economy. @FeBAF Read the speech here: https://t.co/DP34T2yi7v https://t.co/YIXG950crL
After low-for-long interest rates, how do central banks cope with “lower for longer”? Read our new #IMFBlog on the pros and cons for policymakers.  https://t.co/MnMgWpsm4O https://t.co/qkFQAsgqPS

📅TODAY: December 15 at 8:30am EST/14:30 CET – Deputy Managing Director Antoinette Sayeh presents the keynote address at the #RIF2020 closing session on “Shared visions and cooperative leaderships for #Europe and the world”. @FeBAF
https://t.co/2UbFDRqkde

Speed is of the essence in responding to COVID-19, but there is no reason for transparency and accountability to get lost in the process. Find out how we support the fight against #corruption and help prevent the misuse of emergency COVID-19 funding. https://t.co/pa5FJfyCv9 https://t.co/2uu5WNWnrP
After low-for-long interest rates, how do central banks cope with “lower for longer”? Read our new #IMFBlog on the pros and cons for policymakers.  https://t.co/MnMgWpJXto https://t.co/K1z4NK8xJp

COVID-19 has exacerbated inequality of income and opportunity. It disproportionately impacts low-skilled workers, women & youth. 

Tomorrow at 11am ET IMF Chief @KGeorgieva and @ASCOA @s_segal will discuss ways to support growth & an inclusive recovery. https://t.co/3Mv0n1RlCI https://t.co/PHSCZORd3X

Our latest data on direct investment: US has become both the largest recipient and provider of direct investment in 2019. Check out our newly released Coordinated Direct Investment Survey (CDIS) dataset. https://t.co/6HMsdVawc4 https://t.co/QwJ9py0vVK

IMF Executive Board completes third program review for #Honduras and allows for a disbursement of US$90 million to help the country address the COVID-19 pandemic and the recent tropical storms, including increased health care and social spending. https://t.co/VYXoCOM4D9

How can we promote equity and accountability in emergency public spending? How can we strengthen the role of civil society in monitoring these expenditures? Watch the virtual panel discussion on Wednesday, December 16 at 8:00 AM EST. https://t.co/tr2qpKmYhK #OpenBudgets https://t.co/KwqpOX8EC3

Is high public debt cause for alarm? As governments around the world are taking on debt at levels surpassing those during World War II, some governments will be in a better position to sustain their debt than others. https://t.co/4z8lrvghjL https://t.co/PsEj4VmZgs

Low-for-long interest rates mean policymakers must balance the short run support to the economy vs. the buildup of risks in the long run. Read the new research by IMF Financial Counsellor Tobias Adrian: https://t.co/ew4ZeyjpgV https://t.co/j6U5BuwZaw

Central banks responded to the pandemic and helped avert a catastrophic downturn. The work is not yet done. Countries need more monetary stimulus to support a recovery, and central banks are innovating to provide it. https://t.co/MnMgWpJXto #IMFBlog https://t.co/OKz4U1izsb

Our new regional capacity development center will be based in Almaty and serve 9 countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Kazakhstan, the Kyrgyz Republic, Mongolia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan. Learn more here: https://t.co/5kdKlwS7HX #IMFCapDev https://t.co/Ru5wD1c6py

📢 STARTING SOON: discussion on #inequality with IMF Chief Economist @GitaGopinath, @Gabucher, @jj_saffa, @Jayati1609, and DFI's Matthew Martin. #FightInequality https://t.co/9iGiv3pFxs https://t.co/kgbPKDvuyC
STARTING SOON: A discussion on debt with @CeylaP_IMF @AGelpern @carmenmreinhart and @krogoff. Watch the live stream here https://t.co/wdZlLW3o0p https://t.co/kwDUDcbf7y

IMF’s Zhang: There is strength in unity. We need to work together – with inclusion, resilience, and compassion – to take the sustainable development 2030 agenda from a set of goals to achievements.  Read his speech: https://t.co/gPClW5xsF2 #SDG2030

.@KGeorgieva at #SGFintechFest: A revolution in payments can erase physical distance and make data collateral for loans. For small business, “You no longer have to be big to be global.” https://t.co/k0z9O1E0Zg #fintech https://t.co/qEIcMhvZl0

When is a sovereign debt restructuring needed? And why can sovereign debt restructurings be difficult to achieve? 

📙 Learn more about the main challenges and how the IMF can facilitate a solution. https://t.co/HBjdqsdkdc https://t.co/pfa0Egk29f

The COVID-19 crisis has highlighted growing inequality across the world. In the latest issue of #FandD, leading progressive economist Heather Boushey (@HBoushey) proposes steps to reduce inequality and transform the US economy. https://t.co/uD47QGbec1 https://t.co/A565u6HChF

Tune in tomorrow for a discussion with @CeylaP_IMF @AGelpern @carmenmreinhart and @krogoff on #debt transparency, how and when to restructure government debt, the #G20 common framework for debt relief, and more https://t.co/neNjt7CcjZ https://t.co/6fqRWcWDmp

.@KGeorgieva at #SGFinTechFest: Just as money crosses borders, so too must our regulatory efforts. International cooperation can facilitate cross-border payments and address spillovers. https://t.co/k0z9O1VCnQ #fintech https://t.co/H2TLU4t3Yz

What does the future hold for jobs and opportunity? Our new issue of #FandD magazine, produced in partnership with @WEF, explores the transformative policies needed to reimagine the world of work and reduce inequality. https://t.co/1LDHllQ9RS
In today's edition of the IMF #WeekendRead newsletter we focus on fighting #climatechange and accelerating a green recovery, #fintech, cybersecurity, and more. https://t.co/fAKM5AJXLl
Smart, #greeninvestment can help jump-start the economic recovery. What’s the role for governments? Read more on #IMFBlog https://t.co/r0rrK0BCF9 https://t.co/vBgIIn6AEE

Coal accounts for 44% of global #CO2Emissions, but phasing it out will be a challenge. #Policymakers will face tough questions when considering measures for shifting away from coal. #IMFBlog https://t.co/Q5pmKVclRh https://t.co/KqfFpD1mJ9

While the IMF has moved rapidly to help its country members, countries can also help themselves with growth-friendly policies --said @KGeorgieva at a conference on the impact of the pandemic on #DevelopingCountries.  https://t.co/8GzEv1D1vO https://t.co/XX9YaUe8zZ

Policymakers must prevent #COVID19 from scarring people’s livelihoods and undermining social cohesion, especially when #inequality is already high. Read more on #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/QIH4TAE9HQ https://t.co/SmhEbQt1rg
REPLAY: Virtual Author Talk with @FareedZakaria on his book "Ten Lessons for a Post-Pandemic World." https://t.co/O6sNWIYUDX

Central banks, finance ministries, and the financial sector have to realize that climate considerations are a key economic issue that will affect long term growth and prosperity.

Find out what the IMF does to combat #climatechange.
https://t.co/WGBaBr9US4 https://t.co/hoaig7Yjhb

The #COVID19 pandemic has hit the poor harder both in terms of death rates and economic harm. A recent IMF staff analysis shows that fatalities could drop 73% among the less well off with better testing. #IMFBlog https://t.co/0lEWrNKNi8 https://t.co/B3Pp6kaw5R

@KGeorgieva: “The world has an opportunity to pursue a strong, coordinated, green public investment push. Our research shows countries could achieve a 2/3 bigger boost if they work together.” Watch the replay of the event w/ Mark Carney ➡️ https://t.co/ZkxecIww1I https://t.co/pWJzXlZYlz

#MobileMoney has been a lifeline for the unbanked population of low- and middle-income countries.

But what risks and benefits should countries to weigh when creating policy that favors either the service providers or the end user? https://t.co/qwj5GnM6Oo #fintech https://t.co/N1KHv21ia0

Policies must focus on creating higher-quality jobs for more people. Read the latest issue of #FandD magazine that looks at the future of jobs and economic opportunity. https://t.co/tLc5k4OrTL #IMFBlog https://t.co/tmdZujqMln

.@KGeorgieva: “The IMF is committed to support its 190 member countries transition to the new climate economy. We have no time to waste!” 
 
Learn more, check out https://t.co/WGBaBr9US4

#TogetherForOurPlanet
@UN @UNFCCC https://t.co/9RWlttotVR

#ArtificialIntelligence could cause a growing divergence between rich and poor countries. #Policymakers in developing economies will need to take actions to raise productivity and improve skills. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/uAlyzmufn4 https://t.co/q8aUR6m3Zp

Participating in a one-on-one w/ @KGeorgieva, Mark Carney outlined how the financial sector can come #TogetherForOurPlanet and highlighted the role of the Fund in ensuring a #greenrecovery.

Today marks 5 years since countries reached the historic #ParisAgreement on #ClimateAction. @KGeorgieva explains how we can come #TogetherForOurPlanet and ensure a green and inclusive recovery.  https://t.co/WGBaBr9US4
@UN  @UNFCCC #COP26 https://t.co/x1Dtpx71Ok

According to European researchers, the world just experienced its hottest November on record. 
 
Find out how the IMF contributes to the fight against #climatechange
https://t.co/WGBaBr9US4

#ParisAgreement
#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/gFDj12B1CA

.@KGeorgieva tells an IMF conference on #developingcountries that while the pandemic has had a disproportionate impact on #women, youth and lower-skilled workers, the right investments call help. https://t.co/YcUSXMOXk7 https://t.co/M3z4v3z2sr

“I am proud to say that in this crisis we have embraced wholeheartedly thinking of the post-COVID world as one that is green and fair.” 
This week, @Kgeorgieva discussed w/ Mark Carney the role of the financial sector in fighting #climatechange
Replay here https://t.co/ZkxecIww1I https://t.co/1hwU7MlS7L

Today marks the 5th anniversary of the #ParisAgreement. Watch the replay: @KGeorgieva and Mark Carney discuss what this anniversary means and the way ahead to a successful #COP26 in Glasgow. https://t.co/dzdMUHDHzW

.@KGeorgieva: Failing to invest in making our economies and societies more climate resilient undermines our future growth and wellbeing.
 
Find out how the IMF helps its members to address the looming #climatecrisis. https://t.co/WGBaBr9US4

#ParisAgreement #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/3NegXGH5dJ

@KGeorgieva at the Singapore #Fintech Festival on Friday, December 11 at 9:20 AM EST/10:20 PM SGT. https://t.co/JVTA8ggRwL #SGFintechFest https://t.co/ftLwUCMaWF

Emerging markets account for more than 76% of global coal consumption. Phasing it out can take decades. Green investment, new tech, and supportive policies will help ease the transition for people whose livelihoods depend on coal. #IMFBlog https://t.co/Q5pmKVclRh https://t.co/pw1jmxBlkK
Government policies can help people adapt to rapid change. Read about the IMF’s work on social spending in our latest Annual Report. https://t.co/m4pOr0eRDa https://t.co/g3hIlICJBs

Yesterday, @KGeorgieva talked about how a #greenrecovery requires global cooperation. Watch the replay of her one-on-one discussion w/ Mark Carney for a rundown on the #climateaction we urgently need: https://t.co/ZkxecIww1I https://t.co/g91TeEhhjr
IMF Executive Board Completes the Final Reviews of Côte d’Ivoire’s Extended Credit Facility and Extended Fund Facility Arrangements. https://t.co/mCeLwDp6iS #IMFAfrica https://t.co/JnZR6ZzvMX

In the face of volatile capital flows between countries, IMF analysis suggests that there is no one-size-fits-all response, nor is it a case of anything goes. Optimal policies depend on the nature of shocks and country characteristics. https://t.co/bw4gcztQ2N #IMFBlog

Economists expect coal use to rebound as the world emerges from the #COVID19 crisis. Carbon taxes and support for workers effected by the transition can help phase out coal use. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/Q5pmKVclRh https://t.co/WLJ4URbFa5

How can small businesses access more financing and better use digital financial services during the crisis? Check out our Financial Access #COVID19 Policy Tracker https://t.co/IcNHS69BVn to learn about the latest policy measures from more than 110 countries. #MobileMoney https://t.co/XZIBJuureN

IMF's Weeks-Brown on #IACD2020: The COVID crisis has made fighting corruption more urgent than ever before. We at the IMF remain committed to assisting our members in this fight—now and in the post-COVID world. https://t.co/x6LdvaTSz9 #UnitedAgainstCorruption https://t.co/UOKEBrQmCp

When dealing with volatile capital flows, many #policymakers reach for a mix of policy tools. A new paper lays out a coherent framework for the use of multiple tools to achieve economic and financial stability. https://t.co/bw4gczcfbf #IMFBlog https://t.co/VromWXItc9
IMF Completes High-Level Staff Visit to Zambia. https://t.co/nqGxDlI61I #IMFAfrica

📢📢 STARTING SOON! Conversation on healing the scars of #COVID19 in #DevelopingCountries with @KGeorgieva, @vanyaradzayi, Michael Kremer, Senegal’s @AmadouHott and @cnni’s @EleniGiokos. 
📅 Tomorrow, Dec. 9, at 11:00am EST https://t.co/jkWiv8KZOU

IMF’s Alejandro Werner on #IACD2020: 
An effective anti-corruption strategy requires transparency, strong legal frameworks, intensity of enforcement and clean-up, and perseverance. https://t.co/ZXwAIiypwO  #UnitedAgainstCorruption https://t.co/a2YCD2RNNQ

New IMF research shows countries are challenged to manage cyber risks to their financial systems. International cooperation is lagging behind. Read about six strategies that can strengthen cybersecurity and improve financial stability worldwide. https://t.co/hIoiEiTUKH #IMFBlog

📢 Starting Soon! A discussion on the Pandemic in #DevelopingCountries: Policies for People with @ricardo_hausman @DRezaBaqir @rglenner @CBKKenya’s Patrick Njoroge, and @AdvaSal https://t.co/Pdbqjq2Tfb https://t.co/Ic5gvlSs2C

IMF's Weeks-Brown on #IACD2020: The COVID crisis has made fighting corruption more urgent than ever before. We at the IMF remain committed to assisting our members in this fight—now and in the post-COVID world.  https://t.co/gPfGXDKGH8 #UnitedAgainstCorruption https://t.co/ldX5ElVRnq

Corruption hurts everyone. It corrodes the government's ability to respond effectively to the COVID-19 crisis. @KGeorgieva addressed the risk of misuse of emergency COVID-19 funding in her interview with @anticorruption. #UnitedAgainstCorruption #IACD2020 https://t.co/gDvwAplrRM

What are the policies that support greater use of digital financial services during the pandemic? Learn more in the latest IMF Financial Access Survey:  https://t.co/Ye6xN2AUAl https://t.co/Z2RqcJZAXT

Will the year to come be a turning point for economic recovery in #DevelopingCountries? 📢📢 Join @KGeorgieva, @vanyaradzayi, Michael Kremer, and Senegal’s @AmadouHott with @cnni’s @EleniGiokos for a discussion on this. 
📅 Tomorrow, Dec. 9, at 11:00am EST https://t.co/9JeVlTLzO5 https://t.co/fuVJNxAnkh

Speed is of the essence in responding to COVID-19, but there is no reason for transparency and accountability to get lost in the process. Find out how we support the fight against #corruption and help prevent the misuse of emergency COVID-19 funding. https://t.co/pa5FJfyCv9 https://t.co/TilSwMxQgl

IMF’s Zhang at @UN_Women Roundtable on a gender-smart approach to recover from the crisis: We must continue to cushion the impact from the crisis, especially for the most vulnerable and for women all around the world. By working together, we will build a better future. https://t.co/t9MQeAabxW
LIVE: @KGeorgieva and Mark Carney, @COP26 Finance Adviser and @UN Special Envoy, as they discuss the path to achieving #netzero2050. https://t.co/WdeposYyUi #ClimateChange https://t.co/nfz8PKV7xa

As online attacks tripled over the last decade, #cybersecurity has clearly become a threat to financial stability. Fighting it must be a shared undertaking across and inside countries. New IMF research outlines how countries can better cooperate. https://t.co/1Txza60Ge7 #IMFBlog https://t.co/DvrxbICd8j

LIVE NOW: #MENA social spending virtual panel with the IMF’s Jihad Azour. See how the region compares to global peers and how more and better spending could lead to important advances and a way to #BuildForwardBetter post #COVID19 https://t.co/uuA0DDParz

We have a great event lined up today to celebrate the 5 year anniversary of the #ParisAgreement. Please join @KGeorgieva and Mark Carney on how to ensure a #greenrecovery from the pandemic. 
 
https://t.co/nfz8PKV7xa

👉Join @KGeorgieva, @vanyaradzayi, Senegal’s Abdoulaye Daouda Diallo, Michael Kremer, and @cnni’s @EleniGiokos on December 9, 11:00am EST for a conversation on how #DevelopingCountries can tackle the impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/jkWiv8KZOU

Join Azour TOMORROW Dec. 8 for a virtual panel on spending in health, education and social protection in #MENA moderated by @afoukara of @AJEnglish w/ Hiba Mohamed Ali Ahmed, Sudan’s Acting Finance Minister, Ruba Jaradat @ilo & Nesrine Jelalia @AlBawsalaTN https://t.co/uuA0DDParz

“As the pandemic resurges across many nations, it is only natural to wish for a swift return to a pre-pandemic world. If only we could quickly lift the clouds of uncertainty, frustration, and despair,” @KGeorgieva writes in F&D’s December issue. https://t.co/f0Y3YnARv0 https://t.co/FBmD7pfqpG

In our latest #WeekendRead newsletter, we explore the December issue of #FandD magazine; learn how vaccines are only one step to ensuring a recovery from the crisis; how technology could widen gaps, among many other highlights. https://t.co/srPX0nPX2u https://t.co/mveXBoH7B6

Wealthy people are more likely to earn higher returns on investments and not just high-risk ones. Research by IMF staff finds the rich also make more on conservative investments. Read more on why here: https://t.co/XKAg8e2mfd #IMFBlog https://t.co/KK5xubvniq

The #COVID19 pandemic has hit the poor harder both in terms of death rates and economic harm. A recent IMF staff analysis shows that fatalities could drop 73% among the less well off with better testing. #IMFBlog https://t.co/0lEWrNKNi8 https://t.co/byTwMyLk1Z

The gap in per capita GDP between advanced and developing economies could widen the more easily workers are replaced by automation. IMF staff explain why and what can be done. #IMFBlog https://t.co/KGaktOV50E https://t.co/7CeGJa4Gy5
